subject: Photography
title: The Flaneur: Walking as Practice
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Flaneur: Walking as Practice usable.

hook.text: The flaneur is a wanderer who observes city life with no purpose other than seeing. It's photography as meditation.

buildup.text: The concept comes from 19th-century Paris â€” an idle walker who reads the city like a book.

discovery.text: Street photographers adopt this mindset: walk slowly, observe deeply, let the city reveal its stories.

twist.text: It's the opposite of efficiency. You don't go somewhere to photograph something. You wander until something finds you.

climax.text: The flaneur philosophy turns walking into creative practice. The journey matters more than the destination.

punchline.text: Don't look for photos. Let them find you.

quiz.question: What is a flaneur in the context of street photography?
options: A wanderer who observes city life deeply without a specific goal
